children.subject: Yes it has been. Submit the form to apply and if accepted (p good chance of this) you'll be added to our staff Slack, which has all the latest info

history.content:
Hi former CS61C students! We are looking for qualified students to become academic interns (AIs) for Fall 2019.

As an academic intern you will have the chance to experience helping students the way you were helped in CS 61C by working with them to answer questions about assignments and concepts during lab. Through your semester as an academic intern, you'll gain a deeper understanding of the course material, engage with students, and get valuable experience toward becoming a tutor or TA. Additionally, you'll be able to receive P/NP units if you're willing to help a minimum number of hours per week.

Please fill out this interest form (by Thursday 8/29 at 11:59PM) if you're interested in becoming an AI for CS61C during the Fall 2019 semester! Log in with your @berkeley.edu account to see the form.

Interest Form Deadline: Thursday 8/29/2019 at 11:59 PM
EECS Academic Intern Orientation Date: Friday 8/30/2019 from 4:00PM - 5:00PM in Sibley Auditorium

CS61C Academic Intern Weekly Meeting: To be scheduled at a later date. We'll send out a when2meet soon, to get everyone's best availability.

First lab with academic interns: Week of Wednesday 9/11/2019

The responsibilities of an AI include:

- 1 hour of preparation, reflection, pedagogy practice (e.g. doing the weekly lab ahead of time, consulting with the (U)GSI, etc)

- 2 or 4 hours of assisting in lab (based on your preference, gives 1 or 2 units respectively)

- 1 hour of weekly AI meeting (AI meeting to be scheduled at a later date, after EECS-wide AI orientation)

- Please note -- Starting this Fall, the EECS department is requiring all academic interns to be enrolled in mandatory 1-unit bCourses online section (20-30 minute per week for reflections + pedagogy support). More details at the EECS-wide AI Orientation on Friday 8/30/2019 from 4:00PM - 5:00PM in Sibley Auditorium.

If you have any questions about the role, please email cs61c@berkeley.edu with the subject line [CS61C Fall 19 AI]. Thank you!
